OINT SUBREGISTRARPAGE NO 2
You are my second son. In consideration of the many services/efforts you have rendered to me and the natural affection I have for you, I hereby grant you the Scheduled Property (empty land) worth Rs. 4,05,000/- (four lakh five thousand rupees in words) which is my inheritance and is in my complete possession. The said property is hereby given to you without any consideration and this gift deed is hereby given to you. Therefore, you, your sons and grandsons shall enjoy the said gift property with full rights of inheritance and donation. For this, I, my heirs and descendants shall never make any demands on you or your heirs. This gift deed is written on the assurance that there are no mortgages or encumbrances on the said property and that no one else has any authority over it except me. This is my consent. Signature of the person who wrote it: JOINT SUBREGISTRARG

This property is not assessed. It is not an agency tract area. It is not the property of Shri Government. It is not a property acquired by Shri Government or any other department. The property does not have any granite mines, fish ponds, gardens, or any other buildings. If it is confirmed that they exist, we are liable to be punished under Section 27 & 64 of the Indian Stamp Act.
We have examined the E.C. details regarding the declaration. New U/S 22-B
(Central Act 16 of 1908) vide Andhra Pradesh Ordinance No 7 of 2016
dated 03-12-2016. I hereby certify that the property transferred under this deed i.e., acquired by me through my own/patriarchal/GP, is free from any right other than me, that I have not sold, transacted or otherwise dealt with this property by me and that I have not committed any alienation.
I shall be fully responsible for any discrepancies in the above matters.

sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 1949 of 2022, dated 19/Nov/2022, executed by Killamsetti Vasudev, in favour of his Son, Killamsetti Srinu Babu, towards the property admeasuring an extent of 505.55 Sq. Yds., comprised in survey number 98-1, 98-2, situated in Mamidipalle Village and Grama Panchayath, Sompeta Mandal, within the District of Srikakulam, registered at sub-registrar office Mandasa, is bounded as follows: North by: Wet Land of Killamsetti Ravikumar South by: Vacant Site of Dunna Hemavathi East by: Old NH5 National Highway West by: Site of Dunna Kamalamma
It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or Lease Deed.

Note: It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
